data.title: Aâ€“Z Online Resources
data.text:
The most frequently-used databases

Featured

Alternate Name(s) ancestryle

Provides a wide range of resources for genealogical and historical research. It includes records from the U.S. Census; military records; court, land and probate records; vital and church records; directories; petitions for naturalization; passenger lists and more. Available in library branches.

Featured

Alternate Name(s) ebscoauto

Provides updated service and repair information from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) to help users diagnose problems, and repair and maintain most makes and models of vehicle as far back as 1974, including step-by-step instructions, maintenance schedules, parts information and prices, labor time and cost estimates, technical service bulletins and recalls, specifications and standards, and diagrams. (Formerly AutoMate)

Featured

Alternate Name(s) conrep

Serving to inform and protect consumers, this website companion to "Consumer Reports" magazine offers informative articles and research alongside unbiased ratings and reviews for products and services.

Featured

Alternate Name(s) lil

LinkedIn Learning is an online learning platform with relevant expertly-produced courses covering a variety of topics in Business and Technology. If prompted for an organizational URL or ID, use fairfaxlibrary.

The following databases are newly acquired or being evaluated for a future subscription.

New

Alternate Name(s) Lerner

Lerner Maker Lab is a database for hands-on fun, like a digital makerspace. From cooking to crafting to chemistry projects, Lerner Maker Lab offers a variety of active nonfiction projects while also supporting digital literacy and research skills. Clear step-by-step instructions along with photos and illustrations invite readers to craft, experiment, cook, build, and celebrate through hands-on projects.

New

Alternate Name(s) mag

Digital Magazine Collection

Unlimited Access for Library Card Holders.

Indulge in Unlimited reading of 5000+ Magazines

Newspapers and journals across 40+ categories

New

Alternate Name(s) nlk8

Helping kids and teens find their next favorite title or author, NoveList offers fiction and nonfiction recommendations based on interests, characters, reading level, and the many other qualities that readers look for in a great read. Also provides series information, reviews, lists of award winners, and tools for parents and teachers.

New

Alternate Name(s) ebscoread

Provides adapted material to facilitate research and understanding for readers of all ages who have a basic foundation in English literacy. Access articles and reference sources covering science, math, history, culture, civics, literature, and life skills topics, while developing reading and study skills. Also provides quizzes (with answers) and other educator resources for students and teachers.

New

Online access to print reference titles including American Presidents, Health & Wellness, and Profiles of Virginia.

New

Alternate Name(s) tlo ELL citizenship

Transparent Language Online offers over 100 languages. It includes tools for English language learners for speakers of over 30+ languages; it also includes an American citizenship test prep course. Also included are various learning activities to help you retain what you have learned.

New

Alternate Name(s) UniClass

Offers lifelong learning courses in over 30 subject areas, many of which offer continuing education units (CEUs), with more than 500 courses available, all designed and led by professional instructors.
